recipes.label: Study the Lore which Opens
recipes.startdescription: There are incantations of unseaming, where the space between the words is as potent as the actual syllables. When a thing is opened, we will know its nature. [Any Lore studied with Knock becomes Knock.]

recipes.label: Study the Lore of the Knife
recipes.startdescription: All of the greatest struggles end in death. The Lore of the Knife holds the lessons of those struggles.

recipes.label: Subvert the Lore of the Knife
recipes.startdescription: All things end. I will meditate on the triumph of patience over strength. [This will create Winter lore instead of Edge.]

recipes.label: Study the Lore which Burns
recipes.startdescription: Very few know that smiths and murderers speak the same prayers. I will examine those prayers.

recipes.label: Subvert the Lore which Burns
recipes.startdescription: The Hour called Lionsmith shattered his own sword to escape his master's dominion. All things can be overcome, with sufficient force. [This will create Edge lore instead of Forge.]

recipes.label: Study the Succulent Lore
recipes.startdescription: Certain words beg to be spoken. It is tempting to spend time in their consideration - tempting, and perhaps useful.

recipes.label: Subvert the Succulent Lore
recipes.startdescription: It has been claimed that Grail was born from the first sacrifice. But Moth knows better. [This will create Moth lore instead of Grail.]

recipes.label: Study the Lore Unceasing
recipes.startdescription: There are lessons the anatomist, the dancer and the shaman all learn.

recipes.label: Subvert the Lore Unceasing
recipes.startdescription: What does not cease will succumb, at last, to temptation. [This will create Grail lore instead of Heart.]

recipes.label: Study the Glorious Lore
recipes.startdescription: There is a proverb among the practitioners of the invisible arts: 'Glory visits the house without walls.' I would like to know about glory.

recipes.label: Subvert the Glorious Lore
recipes.startdescription: The magus Julian Coseley claims the Forge of Days split the Sun. Perhaps he was right. [This will create Forge lore instead of Lantern.]

recipes.label: Study the Lore of the Wood
recipes.startdescription: When breath is black at the glass, when mist tautens the skin, when woods walk in winter, we hear these words.

recipes.label: Subvert the Lore of the Wood
recipes.startdescription: The Glory is a question, and the Moth always answers, Yes. [This will create Lantern lore instead of Moth.]

recipes.label: Study the Histories
recipes.startdescription: History is less certain than we are taught. I can learn from the study of its blurred edges.

recipes.label: Study the Ragged Lore
recipes.startdescription: These are the words which chill the air and drink the colour of my skin.

recipes.label: Subvert the Ragged Lore
recipes.startdescription: Even in the snow, in the silence, in the white without colours, life will never quite cease. [This will create Heart lore instead of Winter.]

recipes.label: The Lore of the Knife
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Lore of the Knife, which we call by its aspect, Edge.

recipes.label: The Lore that Burns
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Lore that Burns, which we call by its aspect, Forge.

recipes.label: The Succulent Lore
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Succulent Lore, which we call by its aspect, Grail.

recipes.label: The Lore Unceasing
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Lore Unceasing, which we call by its aspect, Heart.

recipes.label: The Glorious Lore
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Glorious Lore, which we call by its aspect, Lantern.

recipes.label: The Lore of the Wood
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Lore of the Wood, which we call by its aspect, Moth.

recipes.label: The Secret Histories
recipes.description: I've increased my knowledge of the secret histories behind the one we know.

recipes.label: The Ragged Lore
recipes.description: I've increased my mastery of the Ragged Lore, which we call by its aspect, Winter.

recipes.label: All Things End
recipes.description: Patience defeats strength. I've subverted my Edge lore to Winter.

recipes.label: Force Conquers All
recipes.description: I've shattered what I believed before. Thus have I subverted my Forge lore to Edge.

recipes.label: Hunger is Folly
recipes.description: Even the Red Grail falls prey to the buzzing in the brain. I've subverted my Grail lore to Moth.

recipes.label: What Does Not Cease Must Eventually Yield
recipes.description: All that moves must succumb to hunger. I've subverted my Heart lore to Grail.

recipes.label: Sunset at Noon
recipes.description: There are arts in Forge which may split even the sun. I've subverted my Lantern lore to Forge.

recipes.label: The Light Above
recipes.description: The Glory is a question, and Moth always answers Yes. I've subverted my Moth lore to Lantern.

recipes.label: The Life Beneath
recipes.description: Winter's coming must yield at last to spring. I've subverted my Winter lore to Heart.

recipes.label: All Shall Be Opened
recipes.description: When we open a thing, then we learn its nature. I've deepened my understanding of the Lore that Opens, which we call by its aspect, Knock.

recipes.label: All Shall Be Opened
recipes.comments: This exists to remove a Knock lore, if we were combining Knock lores rather than Knock + another. Dangit Kennedy you wouldn't need hacks like this if you'd implemented OR conditions. Aspects don't *quite* always cut it.

recipes.label: The Lessons of Experience
recipes.description: This time, this research has failed. But I've learnt the lessons of experience.

recipes.label: Return to the Fundamentals
recipes.comments: This doesn't participate in the research cycle - it's one-and-done.
recipes.startdescription: Sometimes, I might need to return to a more basic understanding of a particular piece of lore. [This will split the lore into two lower-level fragments. You can recombine it later, but that won't be as easy as splitting it.]
recipes.description: Analysis is a kind of vivisection. Reason is the knife.

recipes.label: Return to the Fundamentals
recipes.comments: This doesn't participate in the research cycle - it's one-and-done.
recipes.startdescription: Sometimes, I might need to return to a more basic understanding of a particular piece of lore. [This will split the lore into two lower-level fragments. You can recombine it later, but that won't be as easy as splitting it.]
recipes.description: Analysis is a kind of vivisection. Reason is the knife.
